messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Being more aware of possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid miscommunication, but we must also remember that cultural stereotypes can harm good business relationships. Although national cultures can shape how we act and think, we are also mostly influenced by the region we live in, the groups we belong to, our age and gender, our company culture and our own life experiences. We should therefore keep these potential differences in the back of our minds instead of using them to put all the people of a nation into the same box.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as 'B2' rather than 'B1' likely because of complex sentence structures and advanced forms. For example, the opening sentence ‘‘Being more aware of possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid miscommunication, but we must also remember that cultural stereotypes can harm good business relationships’’ uses a gerund clause and lengthy phrasing that exceed B1. To address this, simplify the structure by starting with a conditional or a subject–verb construction: “If we are more aware of possible differences in expectations and behaviour, we can avoid miscommunication.” Also consider shortening sentences and avoiding advanced forms like ‘being’ at the beginning. These changes will help ensure the text fits the B1 level.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: If we are aware of differences in expectations and behaviour, we can avoid miscommunication. We should also remember that cultural stereotypes can harm business relationships. National cultures can shape how we act and think. We are influenced by our region, the groups we belong to, our age, our gender, our company culture and our own experiences. Therefore, we should keep these differences in mind and not use them to put all the people of one nation in the same box.

metadata.feedback_text: Your output preserves all original facts and key relationships and meets the CEFR B1 requirement. The meaning is clear, and technical vocabulary has been simplified appropriately. To enhance cohesion and sentence variety, introduce more linking words such as although, however, or but rather than relying on only short sentences. For example, you could combine “National cultures can shape how we act and think” with the previous idea using “Although national cultures can shape how we act and think, we are also influenced by our region, our company culture and our own experiences.” Finally, consider adding a brief definition or example of “cultural stereotypes” to ensure full comprehension for B1 readers. These changes will improve flow and reader engagement while keeping the language accessible.
